DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim of this study is to investigate if AZD1940 can relieve the pain induced by the surgical removal of one lower wisdom-tooth. This will be done by comparing the effect of AZD1940 to placebo ("inactive substance") on pain. A number of patients will instead receive the common painkiller naproxen for comparison purposes. Rescue medication, acetaminophen, will be allowed if a need for additional painkillers would arise. A number of patients will receive Naproxen as control.
DOC.brief_title: Study to Investigate the Analgesic Efficacy of a Single Dose of AZD1940
DOC.criteria: Patients scheduled for surgical removal of one partial or complete impacted mandibular third molar. Provision of signed informed consent. Healthy males or nonfertile females. History of somatic disease/condition, which may interfere with the objectives of the study, as judged by the investigator. History of previous or ongoing psychiatric disease/condition including psychosis, affective disorder, anxiety disorder, borderline state and personality disorder according to the criteria in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorder, 4th edition.
